description: When Chinese president Xi Jinping dines next week at the White House at the state dinner in his honor, it’s a good bet that burgers won’t be on the menu.That’s despite the unsolicited entertaining advice offered to the White House by GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump. Trump, among other Republicans vying for the party’s nomination, has been slamming the Chinese visit and its accompanying state dinner, going so far as to suggest that were he president, he’d skip the pomp and circumstance, feed Jinping a McDonald’s combo platter and call it a night.Read full article >>
title: Reliable Source: Dining with the frenemy: high steaks at state dinner for China
